lessonInfo: Sukūn: A small circular sign written above a letter ( ْ ). This sign is called Sukūn in Arabic.
Sukūn indicates that a letter is pronounced without a vowel sound. When a letter with a vowel is followed by a letter with Sukūn, it forms a closed syllable.
For example, when a Hamza with Fatha is followed by a Lam with Sukūn, it is read as al (اَلْ).
